meanings.definition: An official ban on trade or other commercial activity with a particular country.
meanings.sent1: The embargoed goods were not allowed to be traded with the foreign country.
meanings.sent2: The embargoed items were held back from being sold to the overseas market.
meanings.sent3: The embargoed products decided to have a party in the warehouse instead of going abroad.
meanings.sent4: The embargoed trade was like a locked door, preventing any exchange with the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The embargoed goods sat silently, forbidden from crossing borders.

meanings.definition: To impose an official ban on trade or other commercial activity with a particular country.
meanings.sent1: The government embargoed all transactions with the neighboring nation.
meanings.sent2: They embargoed the shipment of goods to comply with the trade restrictions.
meanings.sent3: The company embargoed the sales, causing confusion among the customers.
meanings.sent4: She embargoed the trade routes, cutting off all communication with the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The authorities embargoed the imports, halting the flow of goods into the country.

meanings.definition: To officially ban the publication of something.
meanings.sent1: The government embargoed the controversial book from being printed.
meanings.sent2: The publisher embargoed the release of the magazine due to sensitive content.
meanings.sent3: The author embargoed their own work, keeping it hidden from the public eye.
meanings.sent4: The editor embargoed the article, preventing it from reaching the readers.
meanings.sent5: The committee embargoed the report, keeping its contents confidential.
